com.google.wave.api
Interface Blip

All Known Implementing Classes:
BlipImpl
public interface Blip

A blip is a unit of conversation in a Wave. It is a node in a tree of other nodes and may have a parent and children. It contains metadata to keep track of contributors and versioning. Changes to this blip will generate Operations that will be applied to the wave once the response has been received by the Robot proxy.

Author:
scovitz@google.com (Seth Covitz), mprasetya@google.com (Marcel Prasetya)

Method Detail

getWavelet

Wavelet getWavelet()
Returns the Wavelet that contains this blip.

Returns:
the wavelet that contains this blip

getBlipId

java.lang.String getBlipId()
Returns the Blip ID corresponding to this blip. This along with the Wave ID and Wavelet ID can uniquely identify this blip. This information can enable the Robot to send future changes to this blip without receiving an event first.

Returns:
the blipId for this blip.

getCreator

java.lang.String getCreator()
Returns the email address corresponding to the Wave user that created this blip.

Returns:
the creator of the blip

Returns the list of contributors to this blip.

Returns:
the list of contributors to this blip

getVersion

long getVersion()
Returns the latest version of the blip.

Returns:

createChild

Blip createChild()
Creates a new blip as a child of the this blip. The child will be appended to the end of the list of children.

Returns:
the newly added child blip

delete

void delete()
Deletes the current blip and all of its descendants.

getChild

Blip getChild(int index)
Returns the Nth child blip of this blip (if available). Use the isChildAvailable() method to check for availability of the child blip. Note: The behavior of this method is dependent on the 'context' settings in the Capabilities XML configuration. Child blips may not have been sent with this event.

Parameters:
index - the index of the child to be returned
Returns:
returns the Nth child blip or null if the blip is not available.

isChildAvailable

boolean isChildAvailable(int index)
Checks whether the Nth child blip of this blip is available to be returned. Note: The behavior of this method is dependent on the 'context' settings in the Capabilities XML configuration. Child blips may not have been sent with this event.

Parameters:
index - the index of the child blip to check
Returns:
true if the child blip is available, false otherwise.

getChildren

java.util.List<Blip> getChildren()
Returns the children blips of this blip. Note: The behavior of this method is dependent on the 'context' settings in the Capabilities XML configuration. Child blips may not have been sent with this event.

Returns:
a list of children blips for this blip.

getChildBlipIds

java.util.List<java.lang.String> getChildBlipIds()
Returns the list of child blips ids for this blip. This call operates on blip metadata and is not dependent on the 'context' setting in the Capabilities XML configuration.

Returns:
the list of child blip ids.

getParent

Blip getParent()
Returns the parent blip for this blip. Use the isParentAvaialble() method to check if the parent is available for this blip. Note: The behavior of this method is dependent on the 'context' settings in the Capabilities XML configuration. The parent blip may not have been sent with this event.

Returns:
the parent blip for this blip or null if it is not available.

getParentBlipId

java.lang.String getParentBlipId()
Returns the parent blip id for this blip. This call operates on blip metadata and is not dependent on the 'context' setting in the Capabilities XML configuration.

Returns:
the parent blip id for this blip.

isParentAvailable

boolean isParentAvailable()
Returns whether the parent blip is available. Note: The behavior of this method is dependent on the 'context' settings in the Capabilities XML configuration. The parent blip may not have been sent with this event.

Returns:
true if the parent is available, false otherwise.

hasChildren

boolean hasChildren()
Determines whether this blip has children. This call operates on blip metadata and is not dependent on the 'context' setting in the Capabilities XML configuration.

Returns:
true if this blip has children, false otherwise.

getDocument

TextView getDocument()
Returns the document content associated with this blip. Use the isDocumentAvailable() method to check for document availability. Note: The behavior of this method is dependent on the 'content' setting in the Capabilities XML configuration.

Returns:
the text view interface to the document content or null if it is not available.

isDocumentAvailable

boolean isDocumentAvailable()
Returns whether the document content is available in the blip. Note: The behavior of this method is dependent on the 'content' setting in the Capabilities XML configuration.

Returns:
true if the document content is available, false otherwise.

Removes an inline blip from this blip.

Parameters:
child - the child blip to be deleted.
